text: Dr. Samuel "Sammy" Lee (August 1, 1920 - December 2, 2016) was an Korean- American diver. He was the first Asian-American to win an Olympic gold medal for the United States in 1948.Steve Almasy: After 60 years, Olympians are fast friends again, CNN.com, 22 Aug 2008 Lee was born in Fresno, California. He was raised in San Francisco, California. Lee studied at the Occidental College in Los Angeles and studied briefly at the University of Southern California. He was also the first man to win gold medals "back-to-back" in Olympic platform diving. This means he won a second gold medal for the same event in the next Olympics, in 1952. Lee, who suffered from dementia and heart disease, died of complications from pneumonia on December 2, 2016 at his home in Newport Beach, California, aged 96. ==References== ==Other websites== * Sammy Lee on hickoksports.com * Sixteen Years in Sixteen Seconds: The Sammy Lee Story written by Paula Yoo, illustrated by Dom Lee, (LEE & LOW BOOKS, 2005), . The inspirational true story of Sammy Lee, a Korean American who overcame discrimination to realize both his fatherâ€™s desire that he become a doctor and his own dream of becoming an Olympic champion diver. * Sammy Lee's profile at Sports Reference.com Category:1920 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American divers Category:Sportspeople from San Francisco Category:Sportspeople from Fresno, California
title: Sammy Lee (diver)
